content.text:
The vestibular system can be stimulated or irritated by an infection of the inner ear or by a tumor (arrow) pressing on the vestibulocochlear nerve. Which of the following would NOT occur? <image 1> 

A. Decreased auditory acuity.
B. Vertigo.
C. Tinnitis.
D. Loss of facial sensation.

D. Loss of facial sensation.

Loss of facial sensation would not occur because the vestibular system is not related to the facial nerve ( VII. Vertigo, decreased auditory acuity, and tinnitus ( ringing in the ears) are all symptoms that can be associated with irritation or stimulation of the vestibular system.
Now, output the final answer and nothing else:
